Association of Human IgG1 Heavy Chain Variants with Neutralization Capacity and Antibody Dependent Cellular Cytoto…

citation.abstract: Human Cytomegalovirus (HCMV) infection is limited by HCMV-specific antibody (AB) functions. Here the association between the genetic marker (GM) 3/17 variants in the IgG1 heavy chain constant region, virus neutralization and NK-cell activation was investigated. In 100 HCMV-seropositive individuals the GM3/17 polymorphism, serum 50% HCMV-AB neutralization (NT50) and in vitro HCMV-AB NK-cell activation was assessed. HCMV NT50 was higher in heterozygous GM3/17 than in GM3/3 persons (P=0.0276). Furthermore, individuals expressing GM3/17 exhibited significantly higher NK-cell activation than persons carrying GM3/3 (P<0.0001) or GM17/17 (P=0.0095). Thus, persons expressing GM3/17 have potentially a selective advantage in HCMV-defense.
citation.title: Association of Human IgG1 Heavy Chain Variants with Neutralization Capacity and Antibody Dependent Cellular Cytotoxicity against HCMV
